Class LetterInventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • LetterInventory

  • public class LetterInventory
extends java.lang.Object
    LetterInventory Class creates, updates & modifies an inventory of the no. of alphabets in a string passed and provides useful methods to get its size, adding or subtracting or returning a useful string of the inventory.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int INVENTORY_SIZE
      fixed size of inventory.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LetterInventory()
      This Constructor creates an empty inventory for the client of the fixed size.
      LetterInventory(java.lang.String data)
      This constructor creates an inventory for the client based of the string passed by client.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LetterInventory add(LetterInventory other)
      This method constructs and returns a new LetterInventory object that represents the SUM of this(current) LetterInventory and the other given LetterInventory.
      int get(char letter)
      This method helps the client to get data from inventory of the specific letter.
      double getLetterPercentage(char letter)
      This method helps the client to know the percentage of given letter in the inventory.
      boolean isEmpty()
      This methods helps the client to know if the inventory is empty.
      void set(char letter, int value)
      This method helps the client to set a specific value of the letter in the inventory.
      int size()
      This method provides the client with the total size of the inventory which is the sum of the letters in inventory.
      LetterInventory subtract(LetterInventory other)
      This method constructs and returns a new LetterInventory object that represents the DIFFERENCE of this(current) LetterInventory and the other given LetterInventory.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This methods helps the client to get a string representation of the inventory.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • INVENTORY_SIZE

        public static final int INVENTORY_SIZE
        fixed size of inventory.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • LetterInventory

        public LetterInventory()
        This Constructor creates an empty inventory for the client of the fixed size.

      • LetterInventory

        public LetterInventory(java.lang.String data)
        This constructor creates an inventory for the client based of the string passed by client.
        Parameters:
        data - is a string to be passed to be processed in inventory.
        Pre Conditions
        assumed parameter passed is a string of alphabets.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public int get(char letter)
        This method helps the client to get data from inventory of the specific letter.
        Parameters:
        letter - Character whose info is needed.
        Returns:
        int value of the letter in inventory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when letter is not an alphabet.
        Pre Conditions
        The letter is an alphabet.

      • set

        public void set(char letter,
                int value)
        This method helps the client to set a specific value of the letter in the inventory.
        Parameters:
        letter - Character which is needed to update its associated value.
        value - int data of the letter to be updated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when letter is not an alphabet & value is a negative number.
        Pre Conditions
        the letter is an alphabet & value is non-negative.

      • size

        public int size()
        This method provides the client with the total size of the inventory which is the sum of the letters in inventory.
        Returns:
        the size of inventory.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        This methods helps the client to know if the inventory is empty.
        Returns:
        true if this inventory is empty.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This methods helps the client to get a string representation of the inventory.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the inventory of all letters in lowercase, sorted and inside square brackets.

      • add

        public LetterInventory add(LetterInventory other)
        This method constructs and returns a new LetterInventory object that represents the SUM of this(current) LetterInventory and the other given LetterInventory.
        Parameters:
        other - LetterInventory object that needs to be added to this LetterInventory.
        Returns:
        LetterInventory object that represents the sum of this & other LetterInventory.
        Pre Conditions
        this & other are LetterInventory object.
        Post Conditions
        this & other remain the same.

      • subtract

        public LetterInventory subtract(LetterInventory other)
        This method constructs and returns a new LetterInventory object that represents the DIFFERENCE of this(current) LetterInventory and the other given LetterInventory.
        Parameters:
        other - LetterInventory object that needs to be subtracted from this LetterInventory.
        Returns:
        LetterInventory object that represents the difference of this & other LetterInventory. Returns null if the difference is negative.
        Pre Conditions
        this & other are LetterInventory object.
        Post Conditions
        this & other remain the same.

      • getLetterPercentage

        public double getLetterPercentage(char letter)
        This method helps the client to know the percentage of given letter in the inventory.
        Parameters:
        letter - Character whose info is needed.
        Returns:
        a double from 0.0 to 1.0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if letter is not an alphabet.
        Pre Conditions
        The letter which is an alphabet only.
